intro: Selinum sublactescens, commonly known as the lesser wormwood, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. The plant has slender, aromatic stems and small, feather-like leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
